name: Todd Rokita
tweet: …This isn’t about fraud at this point, it’s about inaccurate numbers and political agendas causing doubt.”

name: Todd Rokita
tweet: In response to the Governor’s press conference today, Attorney General Rokita shared the following statement: “A lack of global standardization of the data and non-uniform use of criteria is an industry-wide management issue, not an Inspector General Issue…

tweet: I am grateful for their commitment to our communities.  https://t.co/4UorwEL6Y1

name: Todd Rokita
tweet: As I said (among other comments I made related to this issue that were not covered by the mainstream news machine) in the full interview linked here, our health care workers are heroes, and that’s why I have gone to court to defend their individual liberties.

name: Todd Rokita
tweet: But I encourage everyone to be critical consumers of information and apply common sense to statistics, just like my office and I advise regarding any consumer protection issue.

name: Todd Rokita
tweet: This problem is international in scope and somewhat natural given how quickly the China virus was thrust on the world. Of course, these reporting irregularities do not discount the lives that have been affected by the virus.

name: Todd Rokita
tweet: The reporter interrupted my response to his earlier question mid-comment and interjected the state health department as the culprit. I continued by finishing my answer to the original question.

name: Todd Rokita
tweet: …when objectively considering data accuracy. By the way, I did not say this was some kind of Indiana government failure as several of the dying, agenda-driven mainstream media have claimed.

name: Todd Rokita
tweet: Yet, because of the lack of standardization of criteria governing the way various individuals and entities collect and report such data, there is a lot of ‘wiggle room’, not to mention monetary and other motivations that must be taken into account…

name: Todd Rokita
tweet: …where non-COVID illnesses or deaths are inappropriately categorized as COVID, which further creates fear. Dying with COVID (where the primary cause of death is some other co-morbidity) is not the same as dying of COVID, for example.

name: Todd Rokita
tweet: I stand by the concerns of a significant number of Hoosiers and Americans about the politicization of COVID reporting. Also, there are examples from across the country that I hear daily as I travel the state…

tweet: Stay up to date on my office news by subscribing to the Rokita Review. I’m fighting for Hoosier common sense and individual liberties. Subscribe here  https://t.co/HLEGGld0Rf

name: Todd Rokita
tweet: From our family to yours, Kathy and I want to wish everyone a very merry Christmas! During this holy season, we celebrate the birth of Christ as the reason for the season. May your celebrations be filled with the Lord’s blessings and great memories.  https://t.co/RKhw5LfkOu

name: Todd Rokita
tweet: Avoiding Holiday Scams Tip #8: Closely read emails advertising holiday deals to make sure they come from the companies they claim to represent.. Consider navigating to a company’s official site through a trusted search engine rather than clicking a link in an email.

name: Todd Rokita
tweet: I will stand with parents and the Head Start staff in fighting this draconian measure. Americans have already pushed back against Biden’s first three China-virus vaccine mandates. Why would the Left think we would accept this latest masks-and vaccine edict?

name: Todd Rokita
tweet: Hoosiers will not passively accept the trampling of our liberties. Now the fear-mongering Biden administration is targeting Head Start programs - forcing children as young as 2 to wear masks and all staff & volunteers to be vaccinated. https://t.co/NJBXoxldr8

name: Todd Rokita
tweet: Avoiding Holiday Scams Tip #7: Research charities before donating — & follow the same online payment & security rules you would follow w/ online shopping. You can look up charities’ reports & ratings at:  https://t.co/oBuZ5ptpsm;  https://t.co/Yyk2xvzLLA;  https://t.co/dqc24uLOYA;

name: Todd Rokita
tweet: Avoiding Holiday Scams Tip #6: Never make hurried decisions. Scam artists want to pressure you into making a quick commitment to buy from them. Slow down and check out details for yourself.

name: Todd Rokita
tweet: Last week I had the opportunity to discuss vaccine mandates with @WSBT while I was in the Michiana area. It is important that Hoosiers individual liberties are protected in this debate about vaccine mandates.  https://t.co/ksNS4tHoCK

name: Todd Rokita
tweet: Avoiding Holiday Scams Tip #5: Remember that any solicitor who contacts you by phone or email and asks you to pay with a gift card is no doubt a scammer. Do not cooperate with anyone making such a pitch.

name: Todd Rokita
tweet: Last week, I discussed holiday consumer scams with @KaraKenney6. It is important to stay vigilant and watchful for these scams. If it sounds too good to be true or something is off about the situation, most likely it’s a scam.  https://t.co/gv9OEeVvsE

name: Todd Rokita
tweet: Avoiding Holiday Scams Tip #4: If a deal seems too good to be true, then it probably is. Take your time to investigate and be skeptical of such deals. Ask questions. Be sure to read the fine print to make sure you are purchasing exactly what you want on the terms you expect.

name: Todd Rokita
tweet: The holiday scammers are out and on the prowl. When you consider supporting a deserving charity, be careful you don’t become a victim. Remember to stay alert and take your time before you donate or click an email link. Find more helpful tips here:  https://t.co/vOySLNqLtx

name: Todd Rokita
tweet: The fight’s not over, I’ll continue to do all I can to defend your individual liberties.

name: Todd Rokita
tweet: We will not give up our fight against these ludicrous mandates. Along with 23 other Attorneys General, I filed a lawsuit against the Biden Administration forcing preschool programs that receive federal funds to mask toddlers.  https://t.co/NJBXoxldr8

tweet: On Thursday last week, I met with Notre Dame students and the St. Joe County Cyber Crimes Unit, discussing cyber security issues affecting Hoosiers.  https://t.co/nk7uXKazxU

name: Todd Rokita
tweet: Avoiding Holiday Scams Tip #3: If you are purchasing gift cards, make sure you know the expiration date, as well as the terms that apply to the card. Keep receipts associated with gift cards in case they do not get properly activated to the amount you paid.

name: Todd Rokita

name: Todd Rokita
tweet: Hoosiers should be able to trust that investment managers handling their retirement portfolios are motivated by their clients’ best financial interests rather than preferred environmental and social causes.

name: Todd Rokita
tweet: The Clean Air Act does not require the EPA to establish primary standards that remove all pollutants, or all risks, from the air. To neglect the impact changing the air standards will have on employment in the U.S. is to ignore a very real and serious harm to public health.

name: Todd Rokita
tweet: I joined other attorneys general across the country as we urged the administration to strongly reconsider this proposal, which will adversely affect public health, create higher unemployment, more welfare and less economic prosperity.

name: Todd Rokita
tweet: This week, the Biden Administration announced that it would consider changes to the very air standards that the EPA already reviewed, debated, and established last year.  https://t.co/fIXInhCi2j

name: Todd Rokita
tweet: Avoiding Holiday Scams Tip #2: To protect your personal information, refrain from making online purchases while using public Wi-Fi.

tweet: Thanks to Andy and Kim Harris, 225 children will have gifts to open on Christmas morning. Christmas is about giving back and community and I’m glad my office could help take part in that!  https://t.co/RMLoj3uQ12

name: Todd Rokita
tweet: We will not be deterred by the Sixth Circuit’s decision. I am committed to defending Hoosiers’ liberty. We will immediately appeal this finding to the US Supreme Court. These outlandish mandates will not be tolerated.

name: Todd Rokita
tweet: The federal government once again overreaches at the expense of States’ autonomy and the result may be a dramatic effect on property value and use. I support reforms to protect species without impairing rights of landowners.
